About

The About part (I hope you like scrolling)

I’m a designer. I am currently employed in the role of Design Director, at an agency called R/GA. It’s rather large, there’s a few offices about. Up until recently I worked out of the New York office (the “Airport”), whereas now I work out of the home studio that I share with my amazing girlfriend. I have been at R/GA for nearly five years, almost half my time residing in New York. Oh, I didn’t mention that I’m from Sydney? Well I am. I work mostly on the challenging* Verizon account.

Design projects that come to me are usually systematic, with a bit of product here and there. Unsurprisingly, most of the work shown is Verizon. There’s some from Sonic Drive-in (which I worked on with the ATX office), some old stuff from Razorfish, and a few more bits and pieces, but yeah mostly Verizon, or “VZ” as we call it in the “biz” (no calls it the “biz").

At R/GA I’m in the “visual” design “discipline”, but due to the systematic nature of my work, it involves about 25% UX, which can mean working alongside a UX designer, or just doing it myself. The delineation of “visual” with design is flawed, however, I’m happy to run with it to pay the rent. It also involves working with tech quite a bit, so it’s handy that I can code. I can read and write the big three (HTML/CSS/JS), and lately have been leaning into a bit of React which is fun. I’m no unicorn, but it’s fun as heck!

On a long enough timeline I could most likely code a more complicated site than the custom parts of this one (check out the clock yo!), I am usually a bit tired from my full-time job. But when I have downtimeI love to learn from the SuperHi team, the best place to skill up I’ve encountered imho. If I had endless amounts of time I would improve my three.js, GLSL and Unity skills.

More like “lolophon” amirite

Working within a strict design system like Verizon’s can be both limiting and in a way illuminating; as Tom Sachs mentions in “Ten Bullets”, creativity is the enemy. There is a joy in accutely understanding boundaries in which to work. With that said... mostly Verizon work for five years does tend to narrow the possibilities to Neue Haas Grotesk, black, white or red. Hence for my own site, I decided to go with a decidedly zany type choice of the wonderful Beastly by ONHOTypeCo and Beatrice by Sharpco. Throw in a garish backdrop of an unfinished brutalist display letters of my own design, and it’s quite the antidote.
